headline: Debates for Ohio governor, U.S. Senate set for next week
sentences:
Cincinnati Enquirer
Republican and Democratic candidates running for the U.S. Senate and Democratic candidates running for governor will take part in a series of debates March 28-29 hosted by the Ohio Debate Commission at Central State University in Wilberforce.

Candidates: State Senator Matt Dolan, Mike Gibbons, Josh Mandel, Neil Patel, Mark Pukita, Jane Timken, JD Vance
Moderator: Karen Kasler, bureau chief of the Statehouse News Bureau
Democratic Governor Debate
When: Tuesday, March 29 at 7 p.m.

Candidates: Morgan Harper, Traci “TJ” Johnson, Congressman Tim Ryan
Moderator: Spectrum's Curtis Jackson
Republican U.S. Senate debate
When: Monday, March 28, 7 p.m.

All debates will be at Central State University's Paul Robeson Cultural & Performing Arts Center
Democratic U.S. Senate debate
When: Monday, March 28, 11:30 a.m.
The Ohio Debate Commission is a nonprofit organization composed of civic, higher education and media organizations formed in 2018 to foster better debates.

Candidates: Former Cincinnati Mayor John Cranley, Former Dayton Mayor Nan Whaley
Moderator: WVXU's Lucy May
What is the Ohio Debate Commission?
The debates will broadcast statewide on TV, radio and online including on this newspaper's website.
After DeWine withdrew, former Congressman Jim Renacci declined to debate if DeWine was not there.
The Republican governor primary debate scheduled for Tuesday, March 29 was cancelled after Gov.
The U.S. Senate candidates, both Democratic and Republican, are slated to debate on March 28.
Democratic candidates for Ohio governor will hold debates the next day: March 29.
Get more political analysis by listening to the Ohio Politics Explained podcast
In 2020, the ODC hosted a virtual debate for Ohio Supreme Court candidates.
Editors in USA TODAY Network Ohio are members of the commission.
In 2018, the ODC hosted debates for governor and U.S. Senate.
This year would be its first hosting primary debates.
Tickets are no longer available for the events.
All of the questions will be from the public.
